resources.string: I see a clarity in your eyes, a wisdom I haven't seen since… well, in quite some time. \n\nThese days are indeed dark, but even darker ones are approaching. I hope you are prepared for them.
Hello there, wayfarer. I see you're a newcomer to Corinth. \n\nYou should speak with Captain Dupont if you haven't already.
I must say, when the Watcher said we'd find a town, I expected more than this. \n\nThis soddy wee village is on the verge of extinction. Not much gold to be had around here.

It's strange, isn't it, returning to a place you once called home and hardly recognizing it? \n\nI'd have assumed it was my faulty memories, but no, it's the town. Things were much more… harmonious back then.
Welcome to the breadbasket of Aeternum, stranger! \n\nWe don't have much food to spare at present, but I can assure you, it's a temporary problem! We'll be back! As surely as day follows night!
Corinth isn't so bad. We've still got food, for now, at least. \n\nThe Speaker promises things will be better soon.
History gives a strong perspective on the present. \n\nHow can you make sure you don't repeat the mistakes of the past if you don't actually study them?
These are troublesome times. And my delectable treats could bring much needed joy to people. \n\nBut the countryside is so dangerous I can't get back to my kitchen. And I really don't like camping.
When times are tough, people are nervous. And nervous people want armor. \n\nI'm flattered my work is being appreciated, but it's been difficult keeping up with the demand.
Did you see that? No? Ah, well. Maybe next time. \n\nWhen you're a hunter like me, you learn to keep a sharp eye out.
How did you manage to get past the Lost? \n\nThose spectres are everywhere! There's no escaping them!
I've always wanted to join the Iron Rose Company. They're a brave lot. \n\nThey saved me from a grisly death when I was new here. I'd be haunting this island as a Lost if it weren't for them.
Have you seen the spheres? Aren't they magnificent? \n\nI wonder what they were used for…
This land is empty… as empty as my dreams. \n\nMy farm is ruined. What am I to do now? Death is temporary, but suffering seems to spring eternal here.

Aeternum is an island of exotic people and strange beasts, mystical powers, and new lands that need charting. \n\nThere is so little we understand, but we must always start with the ground beneath our feet.

There is a serene little pond up here, a nice place to sit and meditate... as long as the pumas aren't prowling about. \n\nBeware if you go further - there's a very angry Bear. Many have been mauled by trespassing in its lair.
The shortages here in Windsward are just awful! \n\nI haven't been able to create any new clothes. Sadly there just aren't enough supplies to be spared.

Have you found any Ancient tombs? How better to learn about how they lived than to study how they treated their dead! \n\nThough I suppose death is somewhat fluid here… I simply must continue my studies!
There's so much inspiration to be found here, you know? \n\nI could spend years painting the pastoral landscapes of Windsward.
Welcome to 'The Southern Breeze'! May a gentle wind always guide you home! \n\nDo you wish to check in? We'd be happy to have you!
Have you tried the tea? I find it is most calming.
Oh dear, you spooked me! \n\nI'm a little nervous wandering around out here on my own.
A set of well maintained brushes rests here. \n\nSomone must have left them behind.
The journal looks like a trove of knowledge. \n\nBut the size makes you wonder if it was left here on purpose.
Shhh! They'll hear you, and believe me, we don't want that!
What are you doing here? How did you get past the Withered?
Another new face in Corinth. Have you come from the shore? \n\nI'm anticipating a report from the Watcher on that terrible storm. Something's happening down there.
Hold up there, what business do you have in Corinth? A report from the Watcher, eh? OK, I'll take that. \n\nSo it was Corruption causing that hellish storm. Merde! Don't we have enough problems?
Feast to Famine
Speak with the Quartermaster Saatvik Agrawal to find out if you're welcome in Corinth.
Speak with Quartermaster Saatvik Agrawal
Hmm, according to Reese's report, you're quite the hero. Good for you! \n\nWell, hero or not, we can't afford another mouth to feed. Corinth has gone from feast to famine.
"What happened?"

Ask five people, you'll get five theories. Some say we've been cursed, others blame the local Druids. \n\nSome are even calling for the town's leader, the Speaker of the Winds, to step down. But he's doing what he can.
"Is there anything I can do to help?"

Oh right, the hero. Hate to break it to you, hero, but eternal life on Aeternum means eternal trouble. \n\nBut if you want to help, speak with Quartermaster Agrawal. Who knows? Maybe you two can fix everything!
Talk to the Quartermaster. If he says you can stay, then so be it.
Let me know when you and Quartermaster Agrawal have solved our supply crisis. \n\nI'll gather everyone together and we'll boost you up on our shoulders and parade you around town.

Spoken to the Captain, have you? He's normally not quite so dour. Although I suppose he was never a particularly charming man. \n\nIt's just that Windsward has just experienced a bit of bad luck recently.

But all that aside, you're still welcome in Corinth. \n\nAnd really, I shouldn't suggest this famine is the result of bad luck. Our town leader, the "Speaker of the Winds" is entirely responsible for all this.
Rest Assured
Visit the Inn and speak with Innkeep Verildis Jannsen to check in. Discover an old friend at the Inn.
Check in with the Innkeep at the Southern Breeze Inn
"What did the Speaker do?"

He broke a centuries-old tradition and stopped paying tribute to the Sorceress Medea. \n\nShe hasn't been seen or heard from in decades, so many have questioned whether she even exists. Seems the Speaker decided to find out.
"And stopping tribute caused the famine?"

It can’t simply be a coincidence. And I've heard the stories of Medea. She's not someone you cross. \n\nThe question is why the damn Speaker took it upon himself to cancel the tribute without consulting anyone.
"Maybe I should speak with him?"

Absolutely not, you're a guest! I insist you check in at the inn. You came ashore in that terrible storm, I'm sure you need rest. \n\nIn any case, it's my duty to talk to the man. This is my burden to bear.
I really do appreciate your offer to help, but I must decline. \n\nCheck yourself in at the inn and eat a warm meal. Assuming you can scrounge one, that is.
Whether the Speaker decides to resume tribute or not, the real problem now is finding enough food to get us through the week. \n\nI have my work cut out for me.
Welcome to 'The Southern Breeze'! May a gentle wind always guide you home! \n\nYou wish to check in? Now this is a pleasant surprise, two new customers in one day!
Where've you been hiding? I was afraid I'd have to go back to the beach and search for you. \n\nNot that I wanted to stay here, mind you! This hamlet's ready for a bloody wake!
"They do seem to have some problems."
Problems? I've raided tombs more lively than this place! \n\nI don't plan on hanging around here long, not when the winds are shifting the way they are. It's bad business.
Welcome back to 'The Southern Breeze'! May a gentle wind always guide you home! \n\nDo you wish to check in? We'd be happy to have you!
Money Talks
Visit the Trading Post and one of the Storage Sheds in Corinth. Then speak with Grace at the Inn.
Open the Trading Post
Open a Storage Shed
Return to the Inn to speak with Grace
I managed to sell that loot we collected. Never let it be said that Grace O'Malley doesn't pay her debts! \n\nHere's your share of the coin. I think you should get to spending it.
"What should I spend it on?"
There's a trading post here. Not exactly thriving, but you could at least get yourself some new clothes. \n\nI'm telling you this as a friend - you smell like something that washed in with the tide.
"I believe I did."

Well there you go! You can always count on me to tell it to you straight. \n\nGet yourself on to the Trading Post. And if you need to stash anything, there's a storage shed as well. I'll be getting the lay of the land.
You have all that coin jingling in your pockets. Go and spend it! \n\nAnd you never know when someone might steal it when you're not looking.
Even here, civilization is built on a foundation of lies and greed… a flawed structure that shall crumble beneath my might...

See, doesn't spending coin make you feel more alive? Glad one of us got what they needed. \n\nI'm gonna have to find some richer places to plunder before I can get myself a boat and get off this damned rock.

The real tragedy of Corinth is there's no way a girl can make some quick money around here. \n\nThat daft town guard treats me like your servant, leaving me messages to give you. And not a single coin for it!
A Word with the Speaker
Speak with the Speaker of the Winds at the Town Hall in Corinth
Speak with the Speaker of the Winds
"A message? What did he say?"
He said your heroics on the shore got the attention of this so-called "Speaker of the Winds." \n\nSounds like a right charlatan to me. He's waiting for you in the town hall.
I won't be staying here long, but I'll make sure to leave a message when I head out. \n\nKeep your eyes on the horizon, my friend, and stay upwind of your enemies.
Right, I won't be staying here long, but I'll make sure to leave a message when I head out. \n\nKeep your eyes on the horizon, mate, and stay upwind of your enemies.

So here's the one Watcher Reese lavished such high praise on! A real charge-in-and-hit-'em-where-it-counts kinda fighter! \n\nWe need more newcomers like you in Windsward. Everyone around here's gone so damn soft!

I suppose you've heard about the famine that's beset our lands. A crisis that demands action, not finger pointing. \n\nSome people are claiming this was the work of the sorceress Medea, but that's a load of hogwash.
Desperate Measures
Visit Golden Fields to gather food to resupply Corinth.
Help Quartermaster Saatvik salvage Supplies from the {POITags}
Talk to Saatvik Agarwal at {POITags}
Fix the first windmill
Fix the second windmill
Collect Sacks of Grain
Collect Harvested Vegetables from Chests
Fill the Cart with Grain and Vegetables
"You don't think this is about the tribute?"

Of course not! That damned sorceress doesn't deserve our hard-earned goods. But that was a misunderstanding. We sent the damn tribute! \n\nNo, I think this curse was brought on by the Druids. They were the first to transform into soulless Lost.
"The Druids became Lost?"

Aye! Can you imagine such a tragedy? The very people we trusted to care for our crops became monsters and started this damn plague! \n\nNow entire farms and villages are falling Lost - half of Windsward at this point!
"What can I do to help?"
Now that's the spirit! We need fighters, not whiners and nay-sayers! \n\nJust now, Quartermaster Agrawal's headed to the farms to salvage what he can, but he's no warrior. Go and see if you can help.
Look for Quartermaster Agrawal on the road out by the farms. \n\nAnything you salvage from the farms will be put to use, I'll tell you that!
"If we're immortal, why do we need to eat?"
Immortal doesn't mean we're immune from death. \n\nOn the contrary, you'll find there are many ways you can die on Aeternum.
"And eating food prevents that?"
Eating food is a way to make your time here more pleasant. It's amazing how much better people feel after a hearty meal.
"What does it mean to be 'Lost'?"
It’s a wretched semblance of life, a body without a soul. \n\nWe may not age here, but our minds do. Some give in to despair and madness, others lose themselves completely. There’s nothing worse.
How many times do I have to tell people? We sent the damn tribute! \n\nNo matter, Captain Dupont will soon sort out who's been spreading such nasty rumors.

The scene here is unthinkable. A month ago, the most flourishing fields in all Aeternum. Now, this. \n\nThe Druids were such gentle people, and now they're these Lost Swarmancers, destroying the land.
"Is there anything worth salvaging?"
I hope so, because we need it. We must get the Windmills going again, and then recover any sacks of grain that remain untainted. \n\nBut the Lost Swarmancers and Withered are everywhere!
"I'll do it."
You're a brave soul, my friend. I’d protest... if the need weren't so dire. \n\nLook for any farmers who need rescuing, and bring back any sacks of grain you find. And for your own sake, be careful!

Well, it's not as much as I'd hoped, but it's certainly better than nothing. This grain will keep us fed for a few more days at least. \n\nWith the windmills turning again, at least there's hope for the future.
Did you see anyone out there who hasn't become Lost? The Druids, the farmers, surely someone remains. \n\nI know many fled, but it's strange that I've heard no firsthand accounts of how it happened.
Eyewitness Accounts
Rescue and talk to farmers who survived what happened at Golden Fields.
"I'll check the rest of the farm."
Your confidence seems matched by your skill, so I welcome the help. \n\nIndeed, if you rescue anyone you can find, we might be able to get some answers.
"I can search for more food as well."

Good thinking! This farm produced a bountiful crop of fruits and vegetables as well. \n\nThe fields are cursed now, but there are crates of food that have already been harvested. Go on then, I'll wait here.
If there are any farmers, or Druids, I hope they can give us some insight into exactly what transpired here.
Rescue Farmer Lijsbet
Rescue Farmer Michael
Rescue Druid Acolyte Nessa
(Optional) Gather Carrots, Corn, or Barley
Speak with farmer Michael
Speak with Druid Acolyte Nessa
The way is clear now.
Thank you. My family, my farm, all Lost… I'm the only one left.
It's safe, you can leave this place.
Oh, bless you, my friend! I felt my hope fading away! I almost became Withered!
The path is clear.
About time someone came to help! Meet me at the edge of the farm - we should talk!

After what I've seen, I fear eternal life may become eternal torment. It's a sight that will haunt me all my days. \n\nWatching my sweet Therese consumed by beetles, and then rise up again as a Withered…
"How did it start?"

I was by the mill, watching as the Druids spread their verdant blessings. Then suddenly, the blessings turned putrid and began emitting green smoke! \n\nThe Druid nearest me just fell over… and transformed!
"So maybe it was the Druids?"
I just can't believe that! They've always been kind and generous. \n\nThey often spoke of a Verdant Spirit who watched over Windsward. It was a lovely story...
I can't stay here. Too many memories destroyed along with these fields. \n\nWhoever's responsible for this, I'm going to make sure they get what they deserve!
Oh dear, did no one else come through this with their souls intact? \n\nIt should've been me who fell Lost. The others were newer to the island.
"Did you see how it happened?"

No, I was napping in my old chair, when I was startled awake by a Withered bursting through the door! \n\nI think it was young Harrison, poor boy... I ran and hid, and saw nothing more until you came.
I've been on this island longer than I can recall, and I've rebuilt my life many times. \n\nBut I'm so tired… I can't start over again. I simply don't have the heart…
Nothing I've learned in all my studies has prepared me for this. \n\nI've heard of Druids falling ill, or even becoming Lost, but some truly foul magic is at work here.
"Why weren't you affected?"
I've only just returned from completing my Druidic studies at another warren in the north. \n\nSeeing what's happened to everyone… I can't imagine what happened here. Some kind of curse?
"Could it be the Sorceress Medea?"

I've never heard of anyone who could snap their fingers and turn people Lost. If such magic exists, I'd like to know more about it myself. \n\nNo, this is something else, something related to the land itself.
"The Speaker blames the Druids."

Does he now? Is it that old blowhard, Francis Turner? I'll be having a word with Mister Turner, then. \n\nWhatever you're doing to help is most appreciated. I suggest you carry on. I'll seek you out later.
How did the farms deteriorate so quickly? It just doesn't make sense. \n\nTransforming Druids into Swarmancers, that's not human magic. That seems like the magic of the island itself.
I wonder if there's a way…? No one's ever come back from being Lost, but there's a first time for everything, right? \n\nIf I'm the last Druid remaining in Windsward, then it's my duty to try.
"Are you sure you are..."

I'm not certain of anything at this point. The main warren, where I started my studies, lies to the west. \n\nI'll go there to see if any of my fellow Druids remain. There's a good chance, I think. Or at least, I hope…
This business about the tribute to Medea sounds suspicious, but that can't be the cause of all this. \n\nNo it's something in the magic of the land. It has to be…
That, my friend, was most impressive! These vegetables may make all the difference. \n\nI spoke to the farmers you rescued. They said you also rescued a Druid? What did she say?
"She just returned from up north."
Hm, she must be an initiate. They train up north. \n\nPerhaps she can help us make sense of all this. I don't think the Speaker is on the right track, not at all.

The Speaker insists he sent Medea's tribute, which means it would've been carted off by the Iron Rose Mercenaries. \n\nThey're supposed to be protecting these farms as well, but I haven't seen hide nor hair of them.
Tracking the Tribute
Visit the Iron Rose Garrison and find out what happened to the Sorceress Medea's Tribute.
Search for Clues to the Missing Tribute at the Iron Rose Garrison
"The Iron Rose Mercenaries?"

Yes, they were hired by Medea herself, to protect and transport the tribute, but the town had engaged them for security as well. \n\nI haven't seen a single member of the Iron Rose Company since this whole thing started.
"Where can we find them?"

The Iron Keep lies to the northwest. If you can go and find out about the Tribute, it may help us solve this dilemma. \n\nI should get these goods back to town where they're desperately needed. Good luck!
While I appreciate your help gathering food for Corinth, we need to know why the Company of the Iron Rose wasn't here to protect the farm. \n\n Go and visit their garrison.
The fall of the farms. The Swarmancers. It must be connected to the Tribute. \n\nBut we need more information. Something about the Speaker's story isn't adding up.
Are you… oh, no. You're not a soldier of the Iron Rose Company. \n\nI had hoped some of my comrades might've been spared. But hope has withered here.
"I was sent to find the Iron Rose Company."
I'm praying I'm not the only one left! We were supposed to fall back to this location if we were overrun. \n\nBut I've seen no other members of the Iron Rose!
The Speaker's story doesn't add up. He's hiding something, and we must discover what it is. \n\nI'm still skeptical that this curse is the work of Medea.

I don't understand, my comrades were hardened soldiers. Tough bastards, one and all. \n\nWe've all died a time or two. What soldier hasn't on this island? How could every one of them have become Lost?
"What happened?"

We heard the farmers' cries and rushed to help, but the beetles were on us the moment we emerged from the garrison. \n\nWe fought bravely. But when my comrades began to fall, I realized they were returning as Lost.
It makes no sense! The Iron Rose have steel spines and iron resolve! We don't despair! \n\nUltimately, I also fell, beneath the blade of one of my former comrades. I was too shocked to fight back!
Iron and Blood
Rescue any surviving members of the Company of the Iron Rose and discover the fate of Sergeant Cotheran, then meet Leovix Silva at the Iron Keep.
Travel to the Camp site near the Iron Rose Garrison
Make Camp to set a Respawn Point near the Iron Rose Garrison (default: [Y])
Search the {POITags}
Rescue any Survivors
Talk to Gideon
Free Gideon
Learn the fate of Sergeant Cotheran
Recover Sergeant Cotheran's Armband
"You returned with soul intact?"

Yes, but I can’t be the only one! I've fought alongside these soldiers against impossible odds! \n\nNow they become Lost fighting some damn bugs? Sergeant Cotheran, tough as orichalcum! She must be here somewhere.
"I can search for her."
Would you do that? I can't bear to face my former comrades. Not again! \n\nFind Cotheran, then meet me at the Iron Keep to the west. I must report this to Commander Merrill, though I dread doing so.
"Is there anything else?"
Don't forget to set yourself a campsite. If you get in over your head, it's a safe place to go back to. \n\nMy sword arm may not be with you, but my hopes are.
I just need a moment before I go and face Commander Merrill. \n\nShe will no doubt order me to recount every tragic detail.
For god's sake! Where the hell did you come from? Did you see? The entire garrison has turned Lost! \n\nMy brave comrades are all soulless husks. I saw Cotheran fall… I thought I was surely next…
"The way is clear now so get moving!"
Yes, you're right! I can't just stand here awaiting death! My thanks to you, stranger! \n\nBrace yourself, Gideon, you can do this…
I'm fighting my way out of here, one way or another! \n\nI owe it to my Iron Rose comrades to survive! I will never forget you, dear friends!
What a relief to see you again! I'm afraid that the same curse that befell the garrison has struck the Iron Keep as well! \n\nIt's swarming with my Lost brethren!
Commander's Correspondence
Search Iron Keep to find any information about the missing tribute to Medea. Bring anything you find back to Leovix at the tavern in Corinth.
Travel to {POITags} to find information
Search Iron Keep for Clues to the Missing Tribute
Read "Notice of Breach of Contract"
Collect evidence for Leovix
Travel to Corinth
(Optional) Use the Spirit Shrine
What news from the garrison? What's this? Sergeant Cotheran's armband! Oh no... \n\nThe fall of Cotheran the Red, all the more tragic because she had been assigned to escort the tribute to Medea.
"She didn't take the tribute?"
No, we received a missive informing us that Guard Captain Dupont had already taken Medea's tribute. \n\nIt was highly irregular. Of course if Cotheran had gone, she might still have her soul…
"What if Medea didn't get it?"

Are you suggesting the curse is Medea's doing? Dear god, I hope not. Commander Merrill stayed in close communication with the Sorceress. \n\nIf she failed to receive tribute, the Commander would've received a very prompt letter.
"We should investigate."

I cannot raise arms against my fallen comrades. You must fight your way into the Iron Keep alone. I must see the Speaker. \n\nFind what you can, then use the Spirit Shrine to meet me in Corinth. Valor is a beacon, friend!
Do you have any information about the tribute? \n\nCommander Merrill would keep his correspondence on his desk.

You made it-- I almost called you comrade. Did you find anything in the Iron Keep? Ah, so there was correspondence from Medea. \n\nGood heavens! She never received the tribute. She is most displeased.

I do not need your excuses, Commander. 

The Tribute for the season has not arrived on schedule, and as you well know, this is a breach of my contract with the Iron Rose and with the town of Corinth.

Whoever holds the title of Speaker of the Winds these days, they should be reminded of the consequences that are described in detail in the original covenant.

If this situation is not remedied quickly, and to my satisfaction, further reparations will be expected.

I will not hesitate to visit Windsward myself and personally see that the cost is paid for these trangressions. 

Yours in candor and quickly-decreasing patience,
 Medea
The Missing Tribute
Find out what really happened to the tribute to Medea by talking to the Speaker of the Winds and the Captain of the Guard.
Confront Speaker of the Winds Francis Turner with Medea's letter
Speak with Captain Marcel Dupont about Medea's Tribute
If Medea's responsible for this curse, I fear it will only get worse. \n\nThat sorceress is ruthless in a way these people simply do not understand. Those tributes are dear to her.
"So you think it's her?"

I don’t know. But this is precisely why Medea entrusted the Iron Rose with the responsibility for the tribute. \n\nThe Company has never failed to honor a contract, and now the damned Speaker has tarnished our reputation.
"Did you speak with him?"
No, the bastard wouldn't see me, of course. And now I'd only bash his face in. \n\nThis is all the proof we need, however. You should confront him. If he denies it, call me for the bashing.
I swear, if the Speaker doesn't own up to his mistake, you'll have to extract my sabaton from his arse.
Their lies and betrayal shall be exposed… and their empires shall decay and fall before our righteous might…
Aha! The hero who restored our Windmills returns from the field! \n\nGratitude is in short supply in Corinth these days, but I, for one, salute your courage!
"I'm here about the tribute."
Bah! As I've said countless times now, we sent the damn tribute! We can't always guarantee the caravan's safety! \n\nAnd if that vicious Sorceress wants a war over this, we should give her one!
"Was that your plan all along?"

Of course not! The town wants to continue appeasing Medea, so I've tried! 

Even now, if we can recover the tribute, I'll send it! You can help! 

Talk to Captain Dupont. He'll give you the details.
The sorceress has been waiting for an excuse like this. \n\nIt's a cauldron that's been boiling for too long! We'll see, sure enough.

Alright, slow down, hero! Everyone's mad about the stolen tribute, and I bet you're here to volunteer to go after it. \n\nBut reclaiming those goods won't be a walk on the beach. The pirates that hit us are a tough crew.
"Just tell me where to find them."

There are a few pirate dens in Windsward, but it was the Buccaneer Creek bastards that took the tribute. \n\nWord is those pirates are Lost now, so I'm not going after them. But you're the hero, so you go.
If I was putting coin on it, I'd wager the Buccaneer Creek Pirates are going to cut you to ribbons. \n\nOne less mouth to feed, as far as I'm concerned.
You don't have to tell me, I already heard - that weasel Dupont let the tribute get stolen by pirates! \n\nNever would've happened with the Iron Rose! Now we're all paying the price, aren't we?
The Pirate Problem
Travel to the camp site by Buccaneer Creek. Talk to Grace. Then look for Pirate Treasures at Buccaneer Creek.
Scout the area near the Buccaneer Creek Pirates Den
Speak with Grace O'Malley
Search {POITags} for Clues to the Stolen Tribute
Smash Crates to reclaim Stolen Tribute
Collect Pirate Treasure for Grace
Read "Offer from the Speaker"
Collect "Offer from the Speaker"

But honestly, Medea may be ruthless with those who cross her, but I don’t think she'd do this. \n\nUnleash a curse on all of Windsward? Punish innocents? That's cruel even for her. I'm not even sure she has such power.
"So we don't need to recover the tribute?"

I don't know, but it can't hurt. If Medea's not responsible for the curse, we could use her help. \n\nBut truth be told, I need a drink and about a week of sleep. I wouldn't make a good comrade-in-arms right now.
"It's alright. I'll go alone."

We've tangled with the Buccaneer Creek Pirates - they're crafty. If you're going alone, always smart to set up a camp. There's a good spot near the pirates' den. \n\nI'll be at the tavern. Strength be with you, soldier.
I'm still trying to shake those images out of my mind. Those soldiers… I fought alongside them for decades. \n\nI never thought the Iron Rose would end up like this.
I just can't get over it. All this pain because the Speaker decided he'd let the town guard take the tribute this season. \n\nWhat the hell was he thinking?

Captain Dauti, I know we haven't always seen eye-to-eye in the past, but I would invite to join me in an endeavor that will be mutually advantageous.

As I know you're aware, the town of Corinth has been paying tribute to the sorceress Medea for generations - an arrangement that I believe has run its course.

I know you and your crew have sought to "acquire" the Tribute in seasons past, but the Iron Rose has successfully deterred your efforts.

This season, I would invite you to make the attempt once again, with the assurance that the Iron Rose will not be on hand. 

In fact, you may find Guard Captain Dupont is very quick to surrender when you confront him on the road.

In exchange for your participation and your discretion, I will share the locations of the legendary Verdant Gemstones, that we might share in their bounty. 

Yours in good faith, and in confidence,
Francis Turner, Speaker of the Winds

Hah, now this is more like it! Have you seen Buccaneer Creek? There's a place we can get some proper plunder! \n\nIf we play our cards right, we might liberate some of their stolen property and be called heroes for it!
"I'm looking for the stolen tribute."

Ah, now it makes sense! I scouted the place and noticed they seemed to have a boat load of supplies. \n\nMaybe that's your tribute! But hey, if you’re going in there, grab some loot. We'll split the profit.
I see by your expression you realized the same thing I did. Didn't want to discourage you, but your tribute was all gone. \n\nBut tell me you at least found something of value!
"Yes, the pirates' deal with the Speaker."

Well now, that's right devious. Not sure if I'm disappointed or impressed with the bastard. \n\nBut don't judge me, I'd never betray and steal from innocents. I just steal from those who deserve it. Speaking of which...
"Yes, I also found some loot."

Have I told you lately how much I like you? You got a hero's heart, and a clever mind. And you're a trusty mate. \n\nWe should partner up for a little more looting. Maybe even find something to help the town.
Web of Lies
Find evidence that Marcel was here with the pirates. Recover the stolen Verdant Gemstone.
Search Mother's Tears for the "Verdant Gemstone"
Collect Captain Marcel Dupont's Missing Hat
Defeat Pirate Captain Miklos Dauti
Recover the Verdant Gemstone
Return to Grace O'Malley

I couldn't help but notice mention in the Speaker's note of some kinda precious gemstones that were offered in payment. \n\nI know for a fact that these same pirates have another hideout just a stone's throw away.
"Alright, we should check it out."

If we find this so-called “Verdant Gemstone,” we could always sell it back to the town. \n\nOh, don't look at me like that! Fine! I guess if you're the one going in, it'll be your call. Surely, we'll get something for it.
"Did you scout this area also?"
Aye, and if you're going in, I'd recommend the bold approach myself. Just blast through the gate like you own the place! \n\nBut don't get cocky, that captain fights with a right nasty boat anchor.
Think of that precious gemstone, all alone in that hostile place. It's a right heartache! \n\nOne thing's for sure, it's of no use to those rotters now that they've fallen Lost.
So this is where the trail of the missing tribute leads? \n\nThe lies from the Speaker of the Winds just keep piling up.

I must say, I'm quite happy to find someone here other than those foul pirates. \n\nAnd Grace mentioned a letter that referred to a priceless "Verdant Gemstone?" I don't suppose you found such a thing, did you?
"Yes, it was the pirates' payment."

I can't believe it! Please, may I see it? Amazing... \n\nIt's both ironic and incredibly lucky that you found this. You see, I'm convinced Medea did not cause this curse. I believe it's this Verdant Gemstone.
You know, over all these years, I've really come to enjoy living here in Winsward. \n\nWith the Iron Rose Company gone, I'll be moving on. But it's really a damn shame.

The Druidic scrolls mention a Verdant Spirit that's protected Windsward for centuries. \n\nI thought it was just a superstition, but there was an annual tradition to visit the Verdant Shrines where the gemstones were kept.
Think of that precious gemstone, all alone in that hostile place. It's a right heartache! \n\nOne thing's for sure, it's of no use to those rotters now that they've fallen Lost.

I'm a bit disappointed. I thought you and I had a profitable plan before little-miss-bright-eyes came along. \n\nI suppose you'll be wanting to be all generous now. I guess you’ve earned the right to make that decision.
Verdant Restoration
Climb Mirador Shrine, complete the ancient puzzle, restore the gemstone, then speak with Nessa.
Face the Ancient Guardians at Mirador to restore the Verdant Gemstone
Climb up Mirador Shrine
Replace the Verdant Gemstone
Rotate the Glyphs to restore power to the Mirador Shrine
Rotate stone 1
Rotate stone 2
Rotate stone 3
"So there's more than one?"

There are four altogether. One is safe in the warren of Thornhall. We will need to find and restore the other three. \n\nBut first, this gemstone must be returned to its place in the Mirador Shrine. There is a catch, however.
"What's the catch?"

Mirador is a ruin that dates back to the time of the Ancients. It's quite likely protected by Ancient Guardians. \n\nBut if you can get past them and solve the shrine's puzzle, the rest is easy. And I believe in you!

Are you bolstering your courage? I find it helps to imagine something inspiring, like a big slice of lime and elderberry pie. Mmm... \n\nRemember, the sooner that gemstone is restored to the shrine, the sooner Windsward can heal.
Such a small thing that causes such issues… think of how unbalanced it all is.
"The jewel has been replaced!"

You did it! I may have sensed some kind of change in the flora here. Of course, I'm just an apprentice Druid. \n\nYour friend Grace seems a little disappointed. I think she had other plans for the gemstone.
"I'm sure Grace understands…"

Oh, I understand all right! The two of you have decided to play noble heroes and save the land. And I'm leaving here nearly empty-handed. \n\nI'm the one who scouted out the Pirates, you know! I deserve something for my troubles.
"The Speaker owes us all a debt"

Everything we're doing here is for the benefit of Corinth. But I do believe Francis Turner needs to be held to account. \n\nHis dealings with the pirates must be exposed. And the town needs a new Speaker of the Winds.
Hidden Power
Find out the location of the remaining Verdant Gemstones
Ask Nessa about the Gemstones
Investigate {POITags} to find a map
Obtain the first half of the map
Investigate {POITags} for the rest of the map
Obtain the second half of the map
Report to Nessa at {POITags}
Return to Corinth
Speak with Nessa in Corinth
Speak with Saatvik in Corinth
"You could help us, you know."

Oh, so now you want to recruit me into your charity project. I'd refuse but I'll enjoy this. \n\nThat Captain Dupont was a right arsehole to me. I'll hang 'em both out to dry. I'll see you back in town.
"What about the other Gemstones?"

My thoughts exactly. I'll visit the library in Corinth to try and find the location of the other shrines. \n\nHonestly though, I’d love to see the expression on Francis Turner's face. Talk about priceless.
"Alright, let's go to town."

There's one of those Spirit Shrines over that way, if that's your fancy. \n\nI personally prefer an honest walk myself. Either way, I'll race you. I'll have that Speaker strung up before you even get there!
I must say, I'm feeling much better now that we have a plan. \n\nAnd I think this has at least some chance of being successful.
So I tried having a chat with that lying oaf Francis Turner, but that bastard Captain Dupont wouldn't let me pass. \n\nI was trying to think who we could trust here. Maybe that dandy Quartermaster?
"Yes, he can be trusted."

Good. If we can get him on our side, and maybe a couple more, we'll have a little revolution started. \n\nYou go talk to your Quartermaster mate, and I'll hit the tavern. Always the best place for conspiring, you know?

This town's tied up in more secrets and lies than the Pope. \n\nNormally, that would be exactly my kind of place, but I’m feeling uneasy. Too much like being back home. There's some dark history there.

Finally, someone in this town who isn't drinking at the Speaker's poisoned well. I heard you confronted him about the tribute. \n\nOf course, now he and Dupont have fallen back on the classic "the pirates' did it" excuse.
"He made a deal with the pirates. I have proof."

Oh, I simply must see this… Hah! The dirty liar's been caught red-handed! \n\nBut we need to be strategic here. We'll need strength in arms if we're to challenge the Speaker. We've got you, but then maybe a soldier or two?
"Yes. Talk to Leovix of the Iron Rose."

Ah, yes! I saw him in the inn earlier, making preparations to leave town. I'll go and speak with him straightaway. \n\nIn the meantime, that young Druid you rescued out at the farm was looking for you. She's a sharp one.
So, I've spoken with Leovix and your friend, Grace O'Malley. \n\nThe two of them, you and I, and the Druid… I think we have a nice little resistance cooking.

Perfect timing! I've just come from Historian Moira, and I need your help. \n\nMoira says there's a map showing the shrine's locations engraved on a monument in the ancient ruins of Breakwater Bulwark.
"Can we take a rubbing of it?"

Great minds think alike! I've already procured you some charcoal and parchment. \n\nMoira also mentioned the Bottomless Cup has the first half of the map. Might be worth checking out before heading to Breakwater.
"I love a good scavenger hunt."
Once again, you show up just in time! Can I see the map rubbing? \n\nAh, yes, I can see the locations of the two other shrines quite clearly.
Secrets Revealed
Stop Leovix from committing murder!
Speak with Leovix Silva
Speak with Marcel Dupont
Speak with Francis Turner
Collect the Verdant Gemstone from the Speaker's Chest

Now, we must expose the Speaker and force him to tell us where the other Verdant Gemstones are. \n\nThere's just one problem: Captain Leovix seems intent on tying the Speaker to a rock and throwing him into the sea.
"I can understand his anger."

Yes, of course, we all can. But we need the information the Speaker possesses. \n\nYou'll have to convince Leovix to wait until we know where the other gemstones are. In any case, I'm in favor of justice but against violence.
Part of becoming a Druid is taking vows of non-violence. \n\nIf removing the Speaker really requires bloodshed, I'll be staying out of the fray.

Before you counsel patience, I'd ask you to remember the atrocities the Speaker and his conniving lackey have committed. \n\nThey betrayed Medea, the Druids, the Iron Rose, and the entire town. They need to pay in blood!
“We need information first."
Yes, everyone keeps telling me, the location of some stolen jewels, right? \n\nThe Company of the Iron Rose is well-versed in the arts of persuasion. My blade can be very convincing.
“Let me talk to them first.”

Very well. I’ll stay my blade. For now. Those scoundrels best pray to whatever spirits rule this hell that you are successful. \n\nAnd quickly, or else the streets of Corinth will be awash with their blood.

You and that brute Leovix are up to something, aren't you? He's been eyeing me like a hungry wolf. \n\nHis grudge is misplaced. As the Speaker and I have explained, the Buccaneer Creek Pirates are to blame.
"I have your hat, Marcel. One chance to come clean."
My hat? I believe I lost that in, uh, town. Someone must have picked it up. \n\nMy hat proves nothing.
"Do you think Leovix will believe that?"
Oh, merde! Fine! None of this was my idea, you realize! \n\nFrancis convinced me that we would both get rich off this plan. I was a fool to listen to him!
"Where are the Verdant Gemstones?"

Those cursed things! Superstition or not, I never wanted anything to do with them! \n\nLook, I only know he has one of the jewels stashed in the Town Hall. Expose him! The oaf deserves it! Just leave me in peace, yes?
Please, I beg you, don't let Leovix do whatever it is that he's thinking of doing. \n\nI'll leave here and you'll never hear from me again. You have my word!
Ah, but this is so unlike you! Why are you snooping around here? \n\nSit down and have a drink with me. If there's some misunderstanding, I'm sure we can work it out.
"Too late. I found the gemstone."
That? Why I’ve never seen it before! If you found that here in the Town Hall, it must have been planted. \n\nIt was probably Captain Dupont! As the Speaker, I order you to apprehend that… traitor!
"You're not Speaker any more."

Oh really? Well, I guess this is it, isn't it? Francis Turner's corruption exposed! I bet everyone's overjoyed. \n\nAll I ever wanted was for this town to stand up against the Sorceress Medea. My intentions were good!
"Not buying it. Where's the third gemstone?"

I'm afraid that found its way into the coffers of Captain Korrapati. Good luck recovering that. \n\nBut I've told you the truth now. I assume this earns me some leniency, right? Right? Are you even listening to me?
Come now, you wouldn't let anyone come after your good old friend, Francis, would you? \n\nI will leave peacefully and trouble no one. I promise. Just give me time to gather my things…
So the Speaker himself had the second gemstone. How did I not see that coming? \n\nSaves us some trouble, I suppose. We can just take it directly to one of the shrines. What about the third gemstone?
"Captain Korrapati has it."
Another pirate, I suspect? Seems those are Francis Turner's closest friends and confidants. \n\nBy the way, we'll need to escort Francis and Captain Dupont out of town without Leovix seeing.
Verdant Connections
Return the Verdant Gemstone to Eldergate by climbing to the top of the ruins.
Travel to {POITags} with the Verdant Gemstone
Restore the Verdant Gemstone
Speak with Saatvik in Corinth
I'll talk to Quartermaster Agrawal about dealing with the two criminals. \n\nAnd then I can start asking around town about this Captain Korrapati character.
"I'll go restore the second gemstone."

You read my mind! Yes, this gemstone should be taken back to the Spire of Kochab to the southwest. \n\nDo be careful if you run into any Ancient Guardians there. I'm afraid you're quite indispensible at this point.
I hear something new on the wind. I believe it's the sound of… yes, it's the sound of procrastination! \n\nA little Druid humor. But the gemstone does need to get to its altar.
Always returning victorious and looking like it was a simple matter! I'm glad you're back. \n\nI understand you've restored another one of these "Verdant Gemstones" to its proper place.
"Yes. How did things go here?"

Well enough. Grace managed to keep Leovix distracted in the tavern long enough to get Francis and Captain Dupont out of town. \n\nOh, and then everyone had to go and elect me as the new Speaker of the Winds.
"That's great. Congratulations!"

Thank you! I only hope we can move fast enough to ensure there's still a town worth speaking for. \n\nAs I mentioned, Grace has been a huge help, but she’s restless and leaving soon. She wanted to speak with you. Go on.
Well now, it seems someone has finally begun restoring my shrines. Why are people so quick to forget their history? \n\nNegligence is costly and never easily remedied.
"So did you unleash this curse?"

I could have, had I wanted to. But no, some fool's meddling with the shrines accomplished that. I am vexed, however, quite vexed. \n\nI've been forced to come here and deal with this. Arousing my ire is not wise.
What's done is done. I shall no longer stand idly by while my work is scorned, broken, disrupted. \n\nThey shall soon see the terrible glory of my craft!

Well look at you, breathing life back into this wee, sad town. You almost make me want to pitch in. \n\nBut I've been anchored here too long. It's time to catch some wind and find more favorable surroundings.
"Where are you going?"
I'll be heading up north. I hear there's a bigger town up there, more modern, much wealthier. \n\nSounds like a place a lass can make some real coin.
Jewel of the Sea
Talk to Nessa near the Pirate Den known as Hecker's Haven. Then enter the Den and challenge Captain Korrapati to recover the third Verdant Gemstone.
Travel to {POITags} to find Captain Korrapati
Speak with Nessa Harrower about Captain Korrapati
Eliminate the alligator Susanna
Obtain the Verdant Gemstone from Captain Korrapati
"This town still needs us."

You've got it covered. And I’m starting to grow moss on my backside. \n\nYou'll need to be going after that third gemstone! That pretty little Druid wants you to meet her to the east. She's scouting out that pirate den.
"Then I guess we're parting ways."

Oh, we'll cross paths again, as surely as day follows night. You're a restless spirit, same as I. \n\nGo help the Druid lass, then catch up with me in the north. Until then, keep your eyes on the horizon!
Go on, then! You better not be getting sentimental on me. I don't have time for that. \n\nBesides, that lass Nessa's waiting for you out there. You need to get that third gemstone.

I'm glad you're here, but I'm afraid I have some bad news. These pirates have been cursed into Lost just like so many others in Windsward. \n\nThat means there won't be any chance of negotiating with them.
"Then we do it the hard way."

Well, just know this Captain Korrapati was particularly nasty before. She's likely worse now. She also has a pet alligator. \n\nI hope you ate a fortifying meal before leaving town. I think you're going to need it.
"I'll be back with the gemstone before you know it."
Patience will win the day. I’d recommend taking out the alligator first. \n\nThere should be some catwalks to help you keep your distance and prevent them from surrounding you. I believe in you!
Splendid! You clearly weren't eaten by the alligator. And you don't even have any rips on your clothes. \n\nNow I regret not tagging along to watch. It must have been an impressive sight!
The Spirit Returns
Return the third Verdant Gemstone to Sirius and solve the ancient puzzle.
Travel to {POITags} with the Verdant Gemstone
Complete the puzzle at Sirius
Rotate stone 1
Rotate stone 2
Restore the Verdant Gemstone

Most importantly, you've recovered the third Verdant Gemstone! We’re finally close to restoring the land’s protections. \n\nYou'll need to take the gemstone to the shrine at the ruins known as Sirius. This should be easy for you!
"Just glad this is the last one."

Agreed! While you head to Sirius, I'll visit town and make sure preparations are under way to resume the tribute. \n\nI'll meet you back here once I'm done. I can't wait until the land is restored. It's going to be marvelous!
It's very exciting, isn't it? Once we've restored the jewel at Sirius, the land can finally heal.
And they shall revel in their false victories, deluding themselves when the true test is still to come…
Did you manage to restore the third Verdant Gemstone? Strange, I thought I would sense something, but it's very faint. \n\nCould it be because I'm still just an apprentice? I have much to learn…
Under New Management
Return to Corinth and speak with the the New Speaker of the Winds.
Speak with Saatvik Agrawal

Corinth is doing better than before. There is order and calm in the streets with Saatvik as the new Speaker of the Winds. \n\nAnd he's moved quickly to resume the tribute to Medea, so it should already be on its way.
"We should head back there."

You definitely should. But now that we've restored the third gemstone, I'm going to visit the Druidic Warren of Thornhall. \n\nI'm hoping by some miracle my fellow Druids are restored as well. I'll see you in town after!
When I see you in town, we'll celebrate with a slice of lime and elderberry pie. \n\nIt really is divine. It almost makes you forget the many horrors of the island we find ourselves trapped on.
Welcome home, comrade! I have assumed the duties of heading up the Town Guard. \n\nSo I am a bit preoccupied right now. You should see the Speaker Agrawal.

Thank the stars you've returned! If the final gemstone has been restored, then that should mean we will soon have reprieve from the famine. \n\nI fear that hunger is quickly eroding the townspeople's patience with their new Speaker.
Abominable Luck
Track down the missing tribute for Speaker Saatvik.
Speak with Leovix Silva in Corinth
Travel to {POITags} to find the missing tribute
Read "Tribute and Reparations"
Collect "Tribute and Reparations"

Unfortunately, there are new developments that may plunge us back into chaos just as we were starting to have hope. \n\nJust minutes ago, Captain Leovix sent word that the tribute encountered trouble on the road.
"Was Leovix escorting it?"
Sadly no. He's overwhelmed with the duties of Town Guard Captain, so he sent some of his new recruits. \n\nCaptain Leovix should be down at the gate. Please find out if anything can be done.
Please talk to Captain Leovix and do whatever is necessary to secure the tribute. \n\nWe can't afford another disaster right now.

To the honorable and wise Lady Medea,

I can certainly understand your displeasure with the town of Corinth for not delivering the seasonal Tribute on schedule, but I hope you will accept my apology and renewed commitment to honor our covenant. 

The former Speaker of the Winds led Corinth with a forked tongue. He had forgotten our promise and the stories of how you have repaid personal betrayals in the past. 

For that very reason, he has been removed from office, and I have been sworn in as the new Speaker. It is my solemn hope to resume the good relations our settlement once enjoyed with you.

In this cart you will find tribute in double the usual quantities, as recompense for late delivery.

I hope you will please reconsider any actions you have taken against our town as punishment for our failure. I know that with your guidance we can return stronger and more fruitful than ever. 

Your humble servant,
Saatvik Argawal, Speaker of the Winds.

Good thing you're here, comrade. You won't believe it, but my recruits just returned with confirmation that the new tribute has come under attack. \n\nI was about to go myself, but if you're willing, I’d prefer it were you.
"Of course, just tell me where to go."

The caravan came under attack at the Bulrush Wash river crossing. I'm told it's a full onslaught of Lost. \n\nRecover what you can, including the Speaker's letter to Medea. I'll prepare a new wagon. Strength be with you!
Whatever it takes, we will save this town, goddamn it! \n\nIf we have to send tribute a hundred times, that's what we'll do.
Behold the cost of breaking your covenant with the Sorceress Medea! \n\nOnce again I am shown that people cannot be trusted to keep their word!
"But this is your tribute!"
Think you a wagon full of goods can appease me? When you have also defiled the shrines I crafted here? \n\nNo, Windsward must suffer far more before I relent.
What's done is done. I shall no longer stand idly by while my work is scorned, broken, disrupted. \n\nThey shall soon see the terrible glory of my craft!
I was headed out to the warren when I witnessed this. Just when we thought everything might start getting better. \n\nI had no idea Medea could command this sort of power.
Every time I have to see the terrible fate that's befallen my fellow Druids, I shudder at the horror. \n\nAfter all our work restoring the Verdant Gemstones, this is enough to make even me lose hope.
The Path of Thorns
Infiltrate Thornhall, the most holy site of Windsward's druids, and find Medea. Convince her to give the region a second chance.
Travel to {POITags} to confront Medea
Defeat Medea
Replace the Verdant Gemstone

This would suggest the famine was Medea's doing all along, but she's only resorted to such cruelty because of the Verdant Gemstones. \n\nMoira mentioned something about Medea's involvement in building the shrines.
"So she's mad about tribute and the shrines?"

Yes, and now she's the one preventing the land from healing. There is a fourth Verdant Gemstone within Thornhall, you see. \n\nShe has taken the warren for herself and removed the gemstone to ensure the curse cannot be lifted.
"We'll have to convince her."

She may not listen to reason, but she must be confronted. My powers pale compared to hers, so I’d be of little help. \n\nBut if anyone can defeat a powerful sorceress like Medea, it will be you. My last hope goes with you.
You are beyond brave to challenge Medea. Her power is truly staggering.
Foolish child, the blood of Helios courses through my veins!
I built Windsward with my own hands! I can destroy it with a snap of my fingers!
I'll have your blood for tribute!
Enough! Your skill is… surprising. I am intrigued.
You'll have to forgive me. I've just spoken with the Sorceress Medea herself. I'm at a loss for words. \n\nI still can't believe that you defeated her, that this is happening.
"What did she say?"

She said that you've proven the people here are worthy, and that she allowed you to restore the final Verdant Gemstone. \n\nI think she wishes to speak with you now. I need to find somewhere to sit down…

Just being near Medea, I could sense great and terrible magic. I must confess, I found it rather elating... \n\nBut you've made all of this possible. You've restored hope to all of Windsward. I'm quite impressed!
A Seed of Hope
Travel north to Fisherman's Bend and talk with Yonas.
Speak with Yonas
Behold, the gifted warrior who bested me approaches. \n\nI am sorely tempted to test you once again.
"Is that really necessary?"

No, but it would be diverting. You possess a rare power not found among newcomers to Aeternum. \n\nAnother possesses this power, but I will not speak her name. She’s the Herald of Corruption, and far more dangerous than you.
"I hear her voice in my head."
Then Corruption already has its hooks in you. They will be extremely difficult to remove. \n\nIt would be foolish for me to take a stand. I'll simply wait for this tempest to blow over.
"Is there anything I can do?"
There's an old man fishing the river not far from here. His simpleminded demeanor belies great wisdom. Seek him out if you would fight Corruption. \n\nAs for me, I will bid you farewell… for now.
There is nothing more for either of us here. \n\nOur destinies lie elsewhere, but we may cross paths again.
After everything we've been through, I'm proud and honored to stand here today. \n\nIf the town of Corinth pulls through this, it's thanks to you, comrade!

My hopes for the other Druids being restored were not realized. My next steps were uncertain. \n\nBut after serious contemplation, I've decided to seek out Medea. I wish to become her apprentice and learn her craft.
"That sounds dangerous."

The decision is not without its perils. But imagine how I could’ve helped Windsward if I had possessed Medea's gifts. \n\nThis power can be used for great good. I will devote my life to making it so. I dearly hope we meet again.
The town of Corinth is finally at peace, though I'm nervous to say that out loud. \n\nThere's a long road ahead, but we will be forever in your debt.
Supply Run
Craft tools, then gather and refine the materials requested by Taleas Serrano.
Craft a {itemName} to help chop down trees
Equip a {itemName}
Craft a {itemName} to help mine stone from boulders
Equip a {itemName}
Gather {itemName} by Mining Boulders
Gather {itemName} by Skinning Boars and Wolves
Gather {itemName} by Chopping Down Trees
Use the Woodshop
Craft {itemName} at Woodshop
Use the Stonecutting Table
Craft {itemName} at Stonecutting Table
Use the Tannery
Craft {itemName} at Tannery
Everyone needs goods, don't they? Sadly, we have none to spare. \n\nAnd it's not just food. Everyone eats, of course. But folks need timber, stone, and leather as well.
"This famine is bad, isn't it?"
Tell that to the annual tribute. That last collection was a kick in the nethers. \n\nOur stores have shriveled up like apples in winter. And it's not exactly safe to go collect more, is it?
"What do you need the most?"

Timber, cut stone, and leather. After all, folks need homes, clothes, and shoes. We have a little food left but could always use more. \n\nHonestly, anything you could bring back would help. Except dung. We got dung aplenty.
Our stores are as barren as a gravedigger's prospects. \n\nHell, I'd even take green wood or flint. Anything just so our stores aren't so damn empty.
Hey, look at this! Something approaching an actual stockpile, I haven't seen that in months! \n\nKeep up the good work. We have other empty spots where goods should go.

Thanks again, friend! We'll find a good use for everything you brought. \n\nWe can strengthen our walls against the Lost. Folks will have new shoes to run away from horrors. And the Speaker can finally get his escritoire!
A Town in Need
Check the Corinth Town Board to discover more ways to help Corinth prosper
Open up the Town Board to find more ways to help Corinth!
Fire Up the Forges!
Craft an Iron Longsword at the Forge and bring it to Mason Zhang Haoyu in Corinth when you have completed your task.
Open Heavy Satchel from inventory to gain Iron Ore
Craft {itemName}s at the Smelter
Craft {itemName}s at the Smelter
Use the Smelter
Use the Forge
Craft an Iron Longsword at the Forge
A new face? I haven't seen you around Corinth before. \n\nI suppose it falls to me to tell you about our current troubles. Wouldn't want you to go around uninformed.
"About the tribute?"

There's trouble with the tribute? I hadn't heard that. I was talking about the Lost overrunning the farms. \n\nSomething happened out there. It's not safe to leave unless you know how to defend yourself.
"I know how to fight."
A solid start. But you should also learn how to make weapons. No blade lasts forever. \n\nHere's some ore to get you started. Then, you should try to make an iron sword.
Open the satchel of ore I gave you, smelt it, then hammer out an iron sword. \n\nYou might need to find some timber first, but it should be simple enough.
Now, let's see your handiwork… impressive. Quite impressive. Either you've done this before, or you've got a knack for it. \n\nWe could use someone like you in Corinth, should you decide to stay.

With the Lost prowling, it's not safe to head outside the settlement's walls without protection. \n\nSome youngsters have been demanding more weapons and armor to defend themselves, but… only a fool would arm anybody that green.
Just Dessert
Travel to Sweet Acre Farm to recover Kathrijn's Blueberry Compote and harvest Strawberries, Blueberries, Squash or Corn.
Travel to {POITags} to collect sweet treats
Search chests for {itemName} at {POITags}
Gather Strawberries, Blueberries, Squash, or Corn

Things are pretty dire, aren't they? We've got Swarmancers, we've got Lost, and people are starting to lose hope. \n\nBut I've got a plan to get everyone's spirits back up! You know what everyone loves?
"Rest? Safety? A day at the beach?"
No, dessert! Who could turn down some tasty treats? \n\nNo one, that's who! I have some ready and waiting back at the farm. I just can't get to them, it's too dangerous!
"I'd brave it for sweets."

Of course you--wait, you really would? A nasty abomination is roaming the fields, and there are so many Withered! \n\nI tried to go back once before, but I…just can't. I hate seeing my friends and family like that.
Those strawberries are going to go bad if you don't get to them soon! \n\nAnd who could resist some homemade blueberry compote!
You did it! You got the desserts! Oh, there will be a feast in Corinth tonight, I tell you! \n\nBut first, how about we try a little here?
"What about dinner?"
What about it? Who needs dinner when you have dessert? \n\nA little sweetness goes a long way in times like these.
Pirates of Spice
Travel to the area around Buccaneer Creek and Mother's Tears to locate the missing spices.
Travel to Buccaneer Creek and Mother's Tears
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName}
Collect {itemName}
Defeat {targetName} Pirates
It's not just dessert that will make the settlement feel better. \n\nAfter weeks of tough, dried meat that tastes like leather, everyone is sure to enjoy a meal full of robust flavor.
"Where will you find such a meal?"

I'm going to help make it! But first, I need something those pirates stole from me. \n\nThey've taken bags of my best spices! Honestly, I can't blame them, my spices do smell delicious. At least those soulless brutes have good taste.
"Hah, good one."
I have my moments. Last I saw, they were heading to Buccaneer Creek and Mother’s Tears. \n\nYou can't miss the spices. Even if you miss the vibrant colors, you just have to follow your nose!
I need my saffron, pepper, and cardamom from the pirates at Mother’s Tears. \n\nWith them, we can make even the blandest rations taste like a feast.
Sweet success! I can smell those spices from here! The fiery peppers, the rich scent of saffron, the warming aroma of cardamom. \n\nI'll have to save some for another batch of desserts.
"What are you going to make?"
I'd love a good, hearty stew. But for starters, I'll make sure our dried meat is well seasoned! \n\nThese spices will put an end to any complaints about more salted wolf, for sure!

This island has all kinds of local plants just waiting to be used in cooking! Some of them are even edible. \n\nEdible doesn't necessarily mean delicious, though. I'll have to try them out for new recipes.
Predator and Prey
Complete Tsui Fen's task to collect meat and fur from the Valley Puma population in Eldergate then return to Tsui Fen's camp.
Travel to the Eldergate region to begin your hunt
Hunt {targetName} for {itemName}
Skin {targetName} for {itemName}

The farms may be unproductive and overrun, but luckily, animals are still abundant. \n\nYou look tough enough to help hunt pumas. They provide good food for the settlement, and hides for the tanner's guild.
"How many do you need?"
You'd be surprised at how much meat I can get out of one puma! \n\nDon't slaughter indiscriminately, we need the local population to be healthy. Just a few will do.
I have mixed feelings about hunting puma, to be frank. \n\nBut Corinth is starving, so I don't feel as bad, so long as the poor beasts don't suffer.
Wonderful! This will make a pleasant change from all the wolf meat we've been eating. \n\nA little variety is good for morale.
The Bear of Scratchrock
Bring down the bear of Scratchrock Burrow. Report back to Tsui Fen when the task is complete.
Locate the remains of the bear's latest victim
Follow the trail of blood and cloth
Follow the trail of blood and cloth
Follow the trail of blood and cloth
Follow the trail of blood and cloth
Follow the trail of blood and cloth
Enter the Burrow and Defeat {targetName}
Oh dear, oh dear. There was another death - the kind that people rarely return from. \n\nGetting mauled by a bear is enough to make even the hardiest souls become Lost.
"Who died?"
Another hunter, Albrekt. He was doing the same thing you were, trying to get more food for everyone. \n\nI imagine he got a bit too close to the bear den, but that's just speculation.
"You want me to hunt down the bear?"

You might want to bring a few friends. \n\nI don't know where the lair is, so you'll have to track the bear down. I guess that means looking for… for whatever remains of poor Albrekt. Try looking near the lake.
This bear is unnaturally savage. It has plenty of natural prey, so it shouldn't keep mauling passersby. \n\nPerhaps the endless cycle of death and rebirth has done something to it.

Taking down that bear was no small feat. It's such a relief to hunt in the area, knowing it will be a while before the bear comes back. \n\nThough I'm still going to avoid its den, and so should you. No sense tempting fate.

Thanks again for helping out. We've got more reliable food now, thanks to you, and camping near the lake has been safer. \n\nI just wish it hadn't been too late for Albrekt. I still haven't seen him return.
Brushed by Fate
Return Fude Hinode's set of brushes to her from where she left them at Eldergate.
Take the Fine Brush Set to Corinth
Find Fude Hinode at the Tavern
A set of well maintained brushes rests here. Somone must have left them behind. \n\nThere seems to be some vellum with them.
"Looks like there's a label on them."
If found, please return to the tavern in Corinth - signed F. Hinode.
The brushes are unlikely to make it back to the settlement without your help.

My brushes! Thank you, thank you! I’ve painted so many places I forgot where I left them. \n\nI tried searching, but as soon as I got anywhere, inspiration would strike and I’d be painting with my second-best set of brushes.
"Are those your easels out there?"

Not just mine. I'm part of a whole group of landscape painters on Aeternum. \n\nYou haven't lived until you've captured the clouds over the bay at sunset, or seen the sun peeking over the mountains at dawn.

This is wonderful! With my favorite set of brushes back in hand, I can paint better landscapes! \n\nWhere should I go next? North to Everfall for all that glorious foliage, or south to First Light and those impressive ruins?
Shot Across the Bow
Sabotage cannons and light striped powderkegs on fire at the pirate stronghold. Defeat Shamgar then return to Michael Lewis.
Travel to {POITags} to thwart the pirates
Sabotage cannons throughout {POITags}
Set fire to the Striped Powderkegs throughout {POITags}
Travel to {POITags} to thwart the pirates
Defeat {targetName}

I won't just watch Windsward go to hell. The Swarmancers, the Withered, the pirates… it's a damned mess, and we have to start somewhere. \n\nHeard Francis was working with the pirates? Well, I know how to stop that.
"What's your idea?"
You know how the Swarmancers destroyed the farm? Ruined the windmills? Made it hard to get anything done? \n\nWell, I plan on returning the favor to the pirates.
"The pirates will be well-defended."

Already thought of that. We start by destroying the cannons. Those stockpiled powderkegs are just asking for a stray spark. \n\nAnd there's a big, mean bruiser who leads their raids. Bloody his nose, and they'll have a hard time retaliating.
Damn pirates, think they can go around raiding decent folk with impunity. Let's see how they like having their homes raided. \n\nLet's see how they like shivering in constant fear.
That'll teach them! I could see those explosions from here! \n\nWith any luck, that will bring us a spell of peace from the pirates.
My farm's lost, but it wasn't all for naught. \n\nI'm going to keep those pirates nice and bottled up in their little hideaway.
Warp and Weft
Collect Loom Patterns and Fabric Samples from Sirius and Stoneview Seabreak.
Travel to {POITags} to collect Loom Patterns
Collect {itemName} from {targetName} enemies
Travel to {POITags} to collect Fabric Samples
Collect {itemName} from {targetName} enemies

I know you're aware of our supply shortages here in Windsward. I've even heard you helped restock our food and wood stores, and for that you have my profound thanks. \n\nBut we are running dangerously low on clothing.
"What about crafting more?"

Crafting takes time, and my method would be a bit faster. \n\nI propose we go in and steal the pants off of those ancient guardians. Well, perhaps not exactly pants, as they don't seem to wear pants, but you get the idea.
"Anything else you need?"

Since you asked, any loom patterns you find will help immensely! \n\nI'll be able to get our production up and running with the new patterns without having to come up with the designs myself. That will save so much time!
Every second you stay here is another thread frayed, another shirt torn, another cloth dirtied. \n\nWe simply cannot go on without new fabric and loom patterns.

My thanks! How utterly divine! Look at this cloth! It has withstood the centuries and yet looks freshly made. \n\nIf only I knew the secrets of those ancient dyes… Such vibrant colors, they’re even more impressive up close!
"Do you need dyes?"
Oh you are a dear, but not yet. First I need to get these to the people of Corinth. \n\nOnce the settlement is reclothed, then perhaps then I'll have time to pursue my studies into ancient dyes.
The Ancients had such wonderful garments, such fantastic cloth, such marvelous dyes. \n\nMy dream is to recreate those stunning fashions and make them into modern sensations.
Towering Tools
Collect any remaining tools of the Ancients from Fallswatch Overlook and Mirador, then return to Antiquarian Pajitnova in Windsward.
Investigate {POITags} for any remaining tools of the Ancients
Collect {itemName}
Investigate {POITags} for any remaining tools of the Ancients
Collect {itemName}
Oh dear, you spooked me! Needless to say, I'm a little nervous wandering around out here on my own. \n\nI must complete my collection, however, whatever risk it requires.
"What collection?"

Oh, well, I am an Antiquarian. Yelena Pajitnova. Nice to... meet you. \n\nI collect tools used by the Ancients - construction tools - whatever they used to build these magificent towers. Only, I've met some resistance.
"I can help if you like."
Oh, would you? Those Guardians are... well... pesky. So I'd reward you handsomely. \n\nAny tools you can recover, I'm most interested in those two sites. Oh, and thank you in advance!
This view is magnificent, isn't it? How they built such wonders is beyond me. \n\nIf you'll recover any tools you can find, I might have a better idea.
You have a gleam in your eye... you've found something? Let me see! \n\nYes, these are precisely the types of things I'm looking for. The Ancients did not share our methods of construction at all.
It's clear they were capable of harnessing some type of energy to aid in their construction. \n\nBut I believe there was some labor involved as well.
Taken to Task
Defeat Kisare the Taskmaster to acquire the Taskmaster's Heart. Then report back to Antiquarian Pajitnova in Windsward.
Travel to {POITags} to locate the Taskmaster's Heart
Defeat {targetName} Guardians
Defeat {targetName} and collect {itemName}
The items you helped add to my collection suggest multiple possibilities for the Ancients' construction methods. \n\nDo return some time and we shall explore these matters further.
"What kind of labor?"

The kind you do with your hands. The funny thing is that we still don't even know what the Ancients look like. \n\nTwo hands? Four hands? No hands? But I believe it was not the Ancients themselves who did the work.
"Who did the work?"

It's not clear, but probably some type of thralls who served the Ancients. \n\nIn Amrine Temple, I've heard speak of an "Ancient Taskmaster." If you can defeat it and bring me a piece of it, that would be an interesting find.
Whatever elements you can recover from the corpse of the Taskmaster would be of greatest interest to me.

Did you defeat the Taskmaster? Amazing! Let me see what you found… \n\nYes, the very heart of this being, clearly not just flesh and blood, but was he once human? This is the perfect addition to my collection! Thank you!
Seeing Clearly (Expedition)
Collect the Antiquarian's Eyepiece from Simon Grey in Amrine Excavation for Antiquarian Pajitnova in Windsward.
Venture Into {POITags}
Defeat {targetName}
Collect {itemName}
Well now, I'm almost starting to think of you as an old friend. \n\nDon't go disappearing on me, now. I'm still mourning the loss of my best friend and former colleague.
"Who are you talking about?"
Simon. Simon Grey, one of the most brilliant researchers on Aeternum. \n\nHe disappeared some time ago in the Amrine Excavation. It's sad for many reasons. Especially for the loss of his equipment.
"His equipment?"

Yes. Simon carried the legendary "Antiquarian's Eyepiece", allowing the wearer to inspect the smallest of details. \n\nIn fact, if you were to find such a thing in the Excavation, I'd reward you handsomely for it.
You must think me callous, wanting Simon's Eyepiece, but I have already mourned Simon's loss. \n\nIf he has no more need of the Eyepiece, it should go to someone who does, like myself.
So it's true then? Simon Grey became Lost, his soul never able to be repaired. Very sad. \n\nHis research was groundbreaking, and I will use the Antiquarian's Eyepiece to honor his legacy. Thank you.
The Eyepiece is even more useful than I remembered. \n\nThank you for retrieving it.
Seeds of Steel
Find and read the creed of the Iron Rose.
Commander Merrill dives under the minotaur's blade, dodges left, weaves right, and plunges his sword into the heart of the beast! \n\nOh, sorry. I didn't notice someone was near. I was… training.
"Training for what?"
To join the Iron Rose Company. Stalwart bastions of valor they are. I don't have a copy of the creed. \n\nYou look like a hardy adventurer. Could you swing by their camp and borrow a copy for me?
"I'd be happy to."
Thank you! I've seen it posted near their encampments. May be multiple pages. \n\nI know I'll have to meditate and learn discipline, but that's difficult without instruction.

I know all the Iron Rose mercenaries. Commander Merrill, Captain Leovix Silva, Cotheran the Red, Gideon Sturm! \n\nSomeone should make small, carven images of them. People could display them on their mantles or windows.
You're back! I had heard that many of them became Lost. I was worried about you.
"I found the creed for you."
Thank you so much! I'll study this and memorize it. Someone has to carry on their legacy. \n\nI'll make myself worthy of the name. With study and dedication, one day I'll be worthy.
Venture to {POITags} and find the creed
Collect "The Iron Creed"
A Garden of Iron
Obtain an Iron Rose Sword for Roya.
The creed says valor is a beacon to those who've lost hope. \n\nLet your blade shine a light in the dark….
"Words to live by."
I agree. Problem is, I don't have a sword. And Iron Rose soldiers ought to have an Iron Rose blade. \n\nThey are very specific weapons. Can't be crafted by just any old smith.
"I could get you one."
That'd be marvelous! I've hit enough sticks against tree trunks, I swear the forest is starting to glare at me.
I hear Iron Rose swords are weighted differently than most. \n\nTheir center of gravity is oddly located, increasing thrusting power.
A warrior is no more noble or sharp than the iron of the blade he carries. \n\nNo more graceful than the way he treats others.
"I have your sword."
Oh thank you, thank you! You truly are a friend. \n\nI'll be able to practice properly now. Trees beware!
Visit {POITags} to find a sword for Roya
Defeat {targetName}
Recover Iron Rose Sword from Weapon Rack
Oh thank you, thank you! You truly are a friend. \n\nI'll be able to practice properly now. Trees beware!
By Any Other Name
Deliver Roya's application to the missing mercenary.
It's all been for nothing. All my training. My research into the Iron Rose... \n\nThere's no chance of me becoming one of their ranks now.
"What's gone wrong?"
I wrote an application letter and took it to Captain Silva. But he's head of the townsguard now. \n\nHe doesn't want anything to do with the Iron Rose.
"There must be other survivors."

I heard a rumor of a man wandering out east wearing their colors. But who knows where he is or if he'll listen. \n\nIt's time I face reality and sought a real trade. I could become a baker, I suppose. Pies are delicious.
"I'll find him. Give me your letter."
I doubt he is even alive anymore. Likely he's Lost like the others. \n\nBut if you want to try, I won't stop you. Here, take it.
Thank you for all you have done for me. Perhaps it's time I embrace the path of all great bakers like… uh… I can't think of any to be honest with you.
Deliver the letter to {destinationName}
Thank you for delivering my letter to Gideon. He told me he will consider my application. \n\nHis response seemed promising. In the meanwhile I'll continue practicing the stances.

Darkness. Death. A baleful curse. That's all that is left of our order. Company of Lies and Ashes is more like it. \n\nI dreamt of defending the countryside with my comrades in arms. But they've all fallen now…
"Valor is a beacon"
Those words! That's our creed. How do you know those words?
"You are not alone. I have a letter from a would be recruit."

An application to join the order… She's been training, and she speaks with discipline. There may be hope for the Iron Rose yet. \n\nI will take her on as my page. Teach her our ways. Thank you, my friend!
When I joined the Iron Rose, I swore to bring beauty and peace to the land with the aid of my sword. \n\nYou have restored that hope in me. I am eternally grateful for your service.
This Mortal Sphere
A group of archeologists have gone missing near an ancient tomb. Follow their trail and discover what has happened then report back to Elric Chapman.
What is in the spheres? A weapon? A treasure? Something more sinister? \n\nThe excavation crew should have found out by now. Where have they gone?
"What spheres?"
Pardon me, I was mostly thinking aloud. Just north of here there's an ancient tomb with strange spheres around it. \n\nWe sent a team of antiquarians to investigate but they have yet to return.
"I can go find them for you."

I would greatly appreciate that. But be cautious, the Ancients wielded powers we don't fully yet understand. \n\nMy team are rigorous note takers. If you discover any of their journals, please collect them. Best of luck!
No luck yet? Oh dear. \n\nCould be they are lost to time - just like my mother's affection. Buried under sand and dust…
You've survived! I was beginning to worry. What did you find?
"They've all become Lost."

I… I had feared that may have happened. Thank you for your efforts. I'll inform their families. \n\nThe secrets of Aeternum yet elude me. But still, I feel as if we are on the verge of a breakthrough.
Read the journal entry 'The Dig Site: Day 1'
Read the journal entry 'Misfortune'
Read the journal entry 'Excavation: Day 15'
Explore {POITags} and Search for the Missing Antiquarians
Creation Myths
Elric has some interesting theories about the spheres. Follow his instructions and set them in place. Then report your findings back to him.
There you are! I've been looking for you. \n\nI have a theory. My mother thinks it's hogwash, but I believe it to hold promise.
"What is it?"

The spheres seem to store power. I believe that if you infuse them with enough azoth, they should be able to interact with other spheres nearby. \n\nYou'll have to find one that's more well preserved than those at the tomb.
"Okay. Where should I look?"
I'd recommend Amrine Temple. Its architecture dates back to the same period as the tomb, but the spheres there are in better condition.
We'll discover the secrets of the Ancients, you and I. That'll prove my worth. \n\nMaybe then my mother will say something nice to me.
You've returned! Were you able to get a reaction from the spheres?
"Yes, it seemed to conjure a random item."

Curious… I've been hypothesizing that the spheres were either a tool of creation or transportation from the Ancients. \n\nI'm not sure what determines what is conjured. I wonder if that's how the buffalo got to this island…?

Curious… I've been hypothesizing that the spheres were either a tool of creation or transportation from the Ancients. \n\nI'm not sure what determines what is conjured. I wonder if that's how the buffalo got to this island…?
Thank you for your aid, my friend. \n\nI worry that my colleagues will laugh at my findings unless I get firm evidence. So I will continue the search.
Fallen Towers, Forgotten Notes
Return the missing journal to its owner.
Take the Tower Journal to Corinth
Find Moira Chapman in Corinth
