The journal looks like a trove of knowledge. It's certainly massive enough. \n\nAfter flipping through the pages, you find an address inked inside the back cover.
"This belongs to Moira Chapman."
The journal looks too important to just leave exposed to the elements like this.
The journal manages to somehow look forlorn.
Have you visited the towers yet? They certainly stand out. Can't get lost with the towers to guide your way. \n\nI wish we knew more about them. They had to be created for some greater purpose!
Oh my goodness! Is that my journal! \n\nI'm impressed, it's a huge undertaking to carry that around!
"It's not light."
But the knowledge inside, it is invaluable! It has all my notes on the towers of Windsward. \n\nDid you know that there have been other studies of the towers, and they have gone missing?
There's no end to what we could learn from the ancients. If you wish to know more, you should speak to my son Elric. \n\nHe's been studying the spheres, those fascinating artifacts!
Zoology 101
Margot is researching strange things in Aeternum. She wants to know why there are Buffalo here. Investigate the area and gather samples and any notes you find regarding them.

Aeternum is a new land full of strange beasts. New paths that need charting. There is so little we understand. Like the Buffalo. \n\nThey just don't make any sense. There must be an answer to the question of them.
"The buffalo?"

They are a species from a completely different part of the world from all others on Aeternum. There must be a reason. \n\nIf you head out to the west of Windsward you will find a herd of them. Collect what you can and bring it back.
"I can do that."
You have my gratitude. It's unlikely that they fell here out of the sky. I'm sure they are just as confused as I am about the whole ordeal.
Haven't discovered anything yet? That's okay. Take your time. The wonders of the world unfurl slowly in our fragile hands.
What have you uncovered about our furry friends?
"The spheres seem to be involved."
Interesting. I'll have to chat with Elric. I believe he has been researching those. There is so much to uncover about this strange and bounteous land. Its mysteries entrance me.
A Wyrd and Wonderful World
Margot has discovered a plant that seems to have strange properties. Gather sprigs of it and present them to people around Windsward to see what their reactions are.
When was the last time you truly stood in wonder of the world? There is glory in the morning dew. The sun's kiss on our cheeks is more warm and gentle than any lover's lips.
"You seem happy."

More people around here would be if they glimsped the glory of Wyrdwood trees. Their beauty is trascendent.\n\nIf you find someone who is down, take them a Wyrdwood sapling. They contain the sparkle of starlight in their branches.
"I'll give it a shot."

They mirror the viewer's intent. If you pause and appreciate them with true wonder, they'll shimmer the lights of heaven back at you. \n\nThey will hold your intent and reflect it in response so others may feel that same awe in kind.

Wonder is a clandestine thing. It seldom shows its face to those who are in a hurry.\n\nIf you find yourself wandering, don't consider the quest incomplete. Think instead of nature unfurling her beauty to you slowly.
Every day is the same. The same walls over and over. The same woes. There is no splendor. \n\n I want to feel excited by life again, but everything has lost its color.
"There is splendor in the flora. Take this sprig."

What is this… it's… remarkable. The light in the branches, see how they shimmer. Has the sky always been so gorgeous?\n\nI couldn't tend to such a marvel. But perhaps you could. Here, take this pot. Keep it thriving forever.
Look at the green of the trees, the azure glory of the river. There is such beauty in the hues of the world.
Where has my zeal gone? I used to be thrilled to tend the crops, to share my food with others, but now it feels empty.\n\nSeems like I've seen all there is to see. Done all there is to do.
"I find zeal in wyrdwoods. Have a sprig."
The light in the stem, it looks like it's dancing. Oh, is it responding to my voice? That's cheeky.\n\nI couldn't take this from you, but you should keep such a wonder safe. Take this.
I walk lighter because of you. There is a pep in these old bones. I am blessed to be alive in this land of marvels.

I've spelunked caverns of the ancients, crossed the sands of Brimstone by foot, and yet the world is still closed to me. I've found no answers. Only more questions. \n\nWhat is the point of searching anymore? To what end?
"Let nature be your answer, have a wyrdwood sprig."

What odd flora. It appears to be calling out to me. I… I've forgotten to be present for nature's beauty. \n\nThank you, kind traveller. Take this as a token of my appreciation. Keep your light shining.
There is more yet to be seen. Not documented and researched, but lived. The eyes do not tire so long as they glimspe the horizon and yearn for tomorrow.

I see smiles on faces that were once dour because of you. To know that even one person breathes easier because of us is to have suceeded. \n\nI hope you remember that whenever you look on the potted saplings. That is true magic.
"It's being present. Being kind."
That's excatly right! Gods be damned - to be present for another human being is to share in their divinity. To be kind is to perform miracles.

There are countless wonders in nature. Be it the song of the wind too perfect for words, or the laughter of the creek babbling on eternally.\n\n Stop and be moved by nature. If you do, it will move through you and bring peace to others.
For years, people doubted me, insulted me. But now they look up to me, for I am a Marauder.
You think you are the stuff of Marauders? Do not underestimate us. Our path demands sacrifice.
I think you have a physique for the Syndicate and a will for the Covenant. Perhaps you should visit them.
Dare you believe yourself worthy of the Marauders? Are you bold only of tongue or can you support that with action?
Long ago, I considered joining the Syndicate. But then I realized that I have a spine.
The Covenant’s folly will always be their desire to help others before themselves. I stand strong on my own two feet.
My initiation into the Marauders was the pivotal moment of my life. Now, accept this challenge to complete yours.
Now that you have officially joined our ranks, we expect you to seize every opportunity to gain honor.\n\nMissions are available anytime on the Faction Board here, and in other settlements.
My blade, my life. Choose your next contribution to our cause.
Glad tidings to you, friend. Lend me an ear and I'll weave you a yarn.
So you seek an audience with yours truly? What subject do you fancy?\n\nAstrology, numerology, alchemy, or any of the other sciences for that matter.

I have quite the thirst for a cold brew from Cormack's place. Don't let my size fool you, I can hold my fill.\n\nBut I digress. Why not take a moment to visit the other faction leaders. See what they're missing.
The look on that distinctive face of yours tells me you've made a decision. Hold me in suspense no longer. Out with it!
One day, perhaps we'll raise a glass together. But not if you keep spoiling the land around here -- Cormack can't get enough hops!
I’ve yet to meet a Templar that made a good drinking buddy, maybe you’ll be the first.
Welcome into the fold. We'll uncork a bottle later, but we have work to do first.
Now that you have officially joined in our enterprise, you should always seek ways to advance our interests.\n\nMissions are available anytime on the Faction Board here, and in other settlements.
Glad to cast eyes upon you again, friend. Have you returned for more adventure?
Of what ilk are you stranger? Care to better Aeternum?
Glad tae meet ye. What can I do for you?
Before you get too far here, go visit those other dobbers. Then come back here and we'll have a blether.
Have you returned to pledge yer life to bearing the light? Gaun yersel.
Your head’s full of mince, Marauder. Go pillage elsewhere.
I’ve seen you skulking around town collecting whispers. You’ll get nothing from me.
Ya’ve made a good move friend. We are stronger together.
Now that you have joined in our cause, you must carry the light into the world at every chance.\n\nMissions are available anytime on the Faction Board here, and in other settlements.
I see the light is still with ye.
Give a sprig to Ahura
Give a sprig to Priya
Give a sprig to Utkarsh
Read "The Baffling Buffalo"
Read "A Close Encounter"
Read "The Song of the Spheres"
Go to {POITags} and search for info on the buffalo
Hello, I'm Master Fisher Shields.
Hello, I'm Master Fisher Shields.
How goes your fishing, {playerName}?
How goes your fishing, {playerName}?
Whine, whine…
Woof!
Bark, bark! (Barkimedes looks happy to see you.)
Bark, bark! (Barkimedes looks happy to see you.)
Fishing With Shields
Collect Woodlouse bait by gathering bushes for Master Fisher Shields. Talk to Master Fisher Shields in Windsward.
"Hello, I'm {playerName}."
Ahoy there, {playerName}! Before you get to the adventure and glory, you'll need to learn how to fill your belly with the bounty of the sea. \n\nFirst, you'll need some bait.
"Where do I get bait?"
Some of the most readily available bait are Woodlice, creepy crawly creatures that reside inside of bushes. The rest you can get through various other means.
Have you found any Woodlice yet? If you look through the splintered remains of the bushes you've gathered you should be able to spot a few of the buggers. Come back to me when you have five of them.
Woodlice draw in larger fish, and believe you me, size matters. Beside that, though, there's still some more basics I want to impart to you, skipper.
Gather bushes to collect {itemName}
Fishing Basics
Cast, hook, and reel in three fish for Master Fisher Shields and deliver them to Master Fisher Ruby in Everfall.
"What should I do next?"

Let's get in on the action now! Fishing involves three basic steps: casting, hooking, and reeling the sucker in. It may take some getting used to but once you get into the pattern you can go for hours nonstop.
"What should I do after that?"
If you can catch three fish, take 'em and go show Ruby in Everfall what ole Shields taught you.
Master Fisher Ruby up in Everfall will appreciate seeing a fresh face to train.\n\n She's a real eager one, and has a lot of natural talent.
You caught these fish yourself? Shields was right to send you in my direction to continue your training. I've got so much to teach you!
Equip your Fishing Pole
Cast your Fishing Pole
Hook fish
Reel in fish
Baited
Catch one Snail in Fresh Water and one Clam in Salt Water to salvage them for bait for Master Fisher Ruby and deliver them to Master Fisher Clemenson in Monarch's Bluff.
"Yes. Master Fisher Shields sent me to you."
In fresh water the more common baits you can acquire are Snails and in ocean water, Clams. \n\nMaster Fisher Clemenson, would greatly appreciate this ocean water bait being delivered to her.
"Why am I fishing for a Master Fisher?"
Don't tell her I said this, but she's been having some trouble getting bites lately.
Master Fisher Clemenson can be a bit rough around the edges but I consider her one of my closest allies in this strange land.
Did Ruby put you up to this? Bah! I don't know why she thinks I need the help...\n\nDon't get too cocky just because you got some bait.
Catch a Snail in Fresh Water and salvage it to create {itemName}
Catch a Clam in Salt Water and salvage it to create {itemName}
Hotspot Hunt
Catch fish from a Hotspot three times for Master Fisher Clemenson and deliver a note to Master Fisher Warwick in Monarch's Bluff.
"What can you teach me?"
Here's a lesson: Have you ever seen a spot in the water that looks like it would be prime for fishing? These are called Hotspots.\n\nTry your luck in these Hotspots and then take this.
"What's this?"
It's a message from me to Master Fisher Warwick. It is imperative that you do not open this note!
Having trouble finding Hotspots? Look along the coast or at inland lakes and rivers. Hotspots can be found in any kind of water and anywhere.\n\nThere are patterns, if you can spot them.
A note from Master Fisher Clemenson? Please, put it down right there. No, my hands are too dirty to touch it right now, but... thank you.
Catch fish from (Active) Hotspots
Practice Makes Perfect
Catch fifteen fish anywhere for Master Fisher Warwick and deliver to Master Fisher Perchal in Cutlass Keys.
"I have something for you."
The best training is hard, focused doing. You've fished up some bait and a few meager samplings of fish, but I want you to fully commit to catching fifteen fish.
"What should I do with all these fish?"
Master Fisher Perchal can be distracted easily, and forgets to eat. Take your fish to her and she will be grateful.
Don't give up now, recruit! Er, I mean, student!\n\nCatch fifteen fish for Master Fisher Perchal. She needs to eat!
Aha! Did you see that? I just fished up my biggest yet!\n\n...What's that? Oh, fish for food rations? I am a bit peckish.
Catch fish anywhere
The Giant Ones
Catch eight fish greater than 20 inches in length for Master Fisher Perchal and deliver it to Master Fisher Park in Brightwood.
"How do fishing and alchemy mix?"

The bait, of course! What's your biggest catch so far? \n\nCatch eight fish longer than 20 inches, and bring them to Master Fisher Park up in Brightwood. She's a fisherwoman and an alchemist, and she's been experimenting with new bait types.
"New bait types?"
Yes, she's researching what bait can reel in the longest fish, so remember to tell her what you used!

Remember, Clams and Oysters in fresh water and Snails and Electric Eels in salt water increase the likelihood of reeling in a bigger fish.\n\nAnything longer than 20 inches. will do for Master Fisher Park and her research.
Multiply by three, carry the one... Woah!\n\nWhat's that you've got? What a specimen! I've been studying fish lengths in relation to their weights and this one fits right in with my findings.
Catch eight fish with a length greater than 20 inches
Fish Reagents
Collect one Squid Ink and one Catfish Whisker after salvaging Squid and Catfish for Master Fisher Park and deliver them to Master Fisher Agarwal in Weaver's Fen.
"Can you teach me about fishing and alchemy?"

Various fish, when properly salvaged, have parts that can be used in Alchemy.\n\nThe whiskers of the Catfish and the ink of the Squid most particularly. Could you collect some and present them to Agarwal in Weaver's Fen?
"Why does she need them?"
Everything on this island thrums with the power of azoth, the fish included.\n\nMaking use of all parts of water creatures is both responsible and pragmatic.
Alchemy in Aeternum is a delicate science that often relies upon elemental reagents. \n\nFishing can help acquire them.
A new way to salvage Catfish and Squids? Why, this is brilliant news! Thank you for coming all this way to inform me of Park's findings.
Catch a Hooked Squid
Catch a Barbed Catfish
Salvage a Hooked Squid for {itemName}
Salvage a Barbed Catfish for {itemName}
Reel Life
Catch three Boots in Weaver's Fen to clean up the waters for Master Fisher Agarwal and deliver a new line to Master Fisher O'Connor in Restless Shore.
"What kind of fish are abundant in the Fen?"
Shoes are most often lost to the swamp's pull, and if you could fish up five Boots that would at least be a start in helping clean up the pollution in the area.
"What should I do when I'm done?"
Once you've helped clean up the Fen, go see Master Fisher O'Connor. They're a spritely one and will likely have a grander task for you.
Five boots, out of the water, and then visit Master Fisher O'Connor. Good luck!
I love to fish more than I love to fight nowadays, though I still do a fair bit of the latter.
Catch Boots in Weaver's Fen
Weapons of the Sea
Catch a Fish Sword and a Fish Head Hammer for Master Fisher O'Connor and present them to Master Fisher Abebe in Mourningdale.
"Agarwal said you had something for me."

The Fish Sword and the Fish Head Hammer are folk legends here - said to have been lost in these waters, long ago.\n\nThey're certainly rare finds. So rare that Fishing Master Abebe doesn't believe me when I say they're out there and itching for a hand to wield them once more.
"Why won't he believe you?"
I may have dashed my credibility by talking about sea monsters in the Restless Shore. \n\nBut I stand by both my sea monster sighting and the existence of these weapons, though.

While perhaps not the mightiest weapons, the Fish Sword and Fish Head Hammer sure are great conversation starters! 'Where'd you get such a nautical weapon?', people will ask, and you can reply: 'I fished it up myself!'
Hail, adventurer. I'm guessing O'Connor sent you my way to settle another one of our disputes... By Jove! Actual weapons fished from the water!
Catch a {itemName}
Catch a {itemName}
Treasures of the Deep
Catch a Treasure Chest for Master Fisher Abebe and present it to Master Fisher Klaus in Great Cleave.
"What can you teach me?"
In this land where rain pours eternal, there are many opportunities for fishing. There is something of greater value than the fish themselves lurking in the depths, though: Treasure chests.
"What do these chests contain?"
Coins, jewels, and all kinds of precious artifacts.\n\nTake your findings to Master Fisher Klaus in Great Cleave to remind him there's more to life than helping the Soulwardens.
The coin is appreciated, but it is the transformative properties of azoth here that I believe make the fish of Aeternum more intelligent.
Hello there. Master Fisher Klaus at your service. You've got to be strong to take on the fish in these parts.\n\nThey learn to fight in these cold mountain waters, and you have to be ready for them.
Catch a {itemName}
Soulwarden Rations
Catch five fish heavier than 30 pounds for Master Fisher Klaus and deliver them to Master Fisher Davies in Edengrove
"He's doing well."

The Soulwardens are hearty eaters, and need large fish to supply their rations with.\n\nCould you catch five large fish and deliver them to Master Fisher Davies? We both oversee the supply of food for the Soulwardens.
"Why provide food to the Soulwardens?"

You would be hungry if you were fighting Corruption the way the Soulwardens do, too. Even though we don't need food to survive on this island it certainly is one way to keep from going insane and losing track of time.
I mark my days with three square meals, mostly fish, of course.\n\nHelps me mark the passing of time.
Aye, that's it… Come to Papa wee little fishes… oh! I didn't see you there. Singing while I fish calms me.\n\nYou've come with the loot of a lifetime for the hungry Soulwardens here.
Catch an {itemName}
Azoth-Tinged Fish
Catch an Azoth-Tinged Fish in Edengrove for Master Fisher Davies and deliver it to Master Fisher Bernard in Shattered Mountain.
"What else is in the water besides fish?"
There are mythical creatures as well, like The Azoth Tinged Fish.
"What's an Azoth Tinged Fish?"

A fish whose entire essence has been possessed and imbued with the magical powers of azoth, of course! Catch one for Bernard in Shattered Mountain, fishing one up here in Edengrove where the water sparkles with azoth.
Don't be discouraged if you haven't yet caught an Azoth Tinged fish, those things are slippery and ephemeral at best.
Ah, I assume you're the new fisher who Master Fisher Davies has sent my way? That is a strange fish you carry there.
Catch fish with a weight greater than 30 pounds
Corruption-Tinged Fish
Catch a Corruption-Tinged Fish in Shattered Mountain and bring it to Master Fisher Chang in Ebonscale.
"Hello, Bernard. Anything else you need?"
Yes. Help me prove something to my fellow Master Fishers.\n\nLike the land here, the waters are tainted by Corruption. I believe the fish are affected, as well.
"Is this like an Azoth-Tinged Fish?"
Yes, I suppose so. Interesting observation. But indeed, catch a Corruption-Tinged Fish and bring it to Master Fisher Chang in Ebonscale - he likely can find the same thing there.
If Corruption seeps down the mountain and into the southern settlements, then all the fish in Aeternum will be affected.
What is that you bring with you, traveler? It reeks of Corruption... Mercy me, is that supposed to be a fish?\n\nMaster Fisher Bernard was right to send you my way.
Catch a {itemName}
Ecological Report
Obtain various levels of fish fillet for Master Fisher Chang in Ebonscale to assess the health of the island's underwater denizens.
"How are the fish of this area?"

I want to do a survey of the fish in other areas to make sure they haven't progressed like the one you brought from Shattered Mountain.\n\nHelp me with this and I will recommend you to the Grand Master Fisher, Gaspar Machera.
"What makes him Grand Master?"

Machera can catch a fish while bound and blindfolded. Some say he doesn’t even need a pole! We should all aspire to his level of expertise.\n\nCatch and fillet fish until you have enough to report back to me.
We must survey the fish on the island to check for levels of Corruption. Then report to the Grand Master.

Greetings, young one. The tides spoke to me of your arrival. You carry fish from all over, yes? Yes, these are untainted. Good...\n\nYou've made great waves, little tadpole. The time has come to see if you can swim with the big ones.
Obtain {itemName}
Obtain {itemName}
Obtain {itemName}
Obtain {itemName}
To Be a Grand Master
Reach Fishing Level 100 and talk to Grand Master Machera in Reekwater.
"Hello, Grand Master."

You must learn to think like a fish if you are to catch fish of greater sizes and legendary species. Beside me I have a list of the legendary fish you can acquaint yourself with on Aeternum.\n\nReach your peak mastery of fishing and return to me.
"How do I reach my 'peak mastery'?"
Listen to the fish. Hear what they have to say, and understand what the water replies in turn. …Most practically, you must practice.
You are not yet one with the fish. Keep training, my minnow, and you will be rewarded for your efforts.

At last you are one with the fish.

You have earned the title Master Fisher, and the respect of all the fishers on Aeternum.

Go forth and fish and be well, friend.
Reach Level 100 in the Fishing Skill
Bones For Barkimedes (Expedition)
Simon Grey's dog Barkimedes is awaiting his master's return and is very hungry. From what you can tell he would appreciate having some Ravager bones to gnaw on.
"What's wrong, boy?"
Sniff, sniff… Ruff! (Barkimedes sounds like he's hungry.)
"Would you like some bones, boy?"
Bark, bark! (Barkimedes sounds pleased at the offer.)
(Barkimedes is panting eagerly, waiting for the bones.)
Woof! (Barkimedes excitedly takes the bones… and promptly buries them.)
Venture into the Amrine Excavation Expedition
Defeat {targetName} to get {itemName} for Barkimedes
More Bones for Barkimedes (Expedition)
Simon Grey's dog Barkimedes wants an enhanced bone-chewing experience from the Enchanted Bones of the Shattered Obelisk expedition.
"Hey boy, want some special bones?"
Ruff, ruff! (Barkimedes' eyes go wide in anticipation and his tail wags.)
"The bones from Starstone Barrows should work."
(Barkimedes lets out an excited howl.)
(Barkimedes is panting eagerly, waiting for the special bones.)
Woof, woof! (Barkimedes chews on the bones ravenously.)
